bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art. Much of the work of the College is accomplished by various standing and pro-tem committees. Standing committees include the Library, Finance, Building, Publications, Fellowship, Women's, Nominations, Ordinances and By-Laws, and Mutter Museum and College Collections Committees.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of various standing and pro-tem Committees of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. Types of materials to be found among these records include minutes, agendas, correspondence, committee and annual reports, financial documents, and membership lists. The largest groupings of records within this collection are those of the Greater Philadelphia Committee for Medical-Pharmaceutical Sciences, the Ad Hoc Committee on Internship and Residency/Pew Memorial Loan Fund Committee, the Fellowship Committee, the Committee on Charter and Bylaws Revisions, and the Building and Hall and Grounds Committees. Other sets of records are comparatively small. Records of the Greater Philadelphia Committee for Medical-Pharmaceutical Sciences date from 1963 to 1984. Records of the Ad Hoc Committee on Internship and Residency/Pew Memorial Loan Fund Committee date from 1961 to 1984, and include applications for internships and grants and letters of recommendation and the results of a survey conducted by the committee in 1962. Fellowship Committee records date from 1974 to 1990, and include lists of candidates and of Fellows, announcements of new Fellows, and materials related to gifts and bequests. Records of the Committee on Charter and Bylaws Revisions date from 1924 to 1980 and document the periodic updating of and amendments to the College's by-laws. Records of the Building and Hall and Grounds Committees date from 1859 to 1987, and include plans for additions to the 22nd Street building and plans for Medical Data Service offices. Other committees represented in the collection include the Committee on Budget and Finance (1980), the Committee for the Division of Medical History, the Committee on the Mutter Museum and College Collections (1972-1978), the Committee on Special College Privileges (1935 and 1938), the Committee on Scientific Business (1911-1978), the Ad Hoc Committee on the Proposal to Combine Museum, College Collections, and Historical Collections (1970-1977), the Mary Scott Newbold Lecture Committee (1923-1938 and 1968), the Committee on Nominations (1935-1940 and 1970-1978), the Scientific Program Committee for the Bicentennial (1976-1976), the Pharmacopoeia Committee (1832-1909), and the Committee on Awards (1995). The collection also includes several plaques from the S. Weir Mitchell Associates Committee.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
